name: Parque do Ingá
address: Av. São Paulo, 1800 - Zona 01, Maringá - PR, 87013-040
description: Maringá's most famous urban park, featuring a beautiful lake, Japanese garden, and a small zoo. Perfect for leisure and outdoor activities.

name: Catedral Basílica Menor Nossa Senhora da Glória
address: Praça da Catedral, 1 - Zona 01, Maringá - PR, 87013-000
description: An iconic conical-shaped cathedral, a symbol of Maringá. Its unique architecture attracts visitors from all over the world.

name: Mercadão de Maringá
address: Av. Prudente de Morais, 601 - Zona 07, Maringá - PR, 87020-010
description: A vibrant public market offering fresh produce, local delicacies, artisanal products, and a variety of food stalls. A true gastronomic experience.

name: Horto Florestal de Maringá
description: A large botanical garden and forest reserve, ideal for walking, birdwatching, and connecting with nature within the city.

name: Universidade Estadual de Maringá (UEM)
description: One of the most important universities in Paraná, known for its beautiful campus and academic excellence. A hub of knowledge and culture.

name: Teatro Calil Haddad
address: Av. Dr. Luiz Teixeira Mendes, 2500 - Zona 05, Maringá - PR, 87015-910
description: Maringá's main cultural venue, hosting plays, concerts, dance performances, and various artistic events throughout the year.

name: Bosque 2 (Bosque das Grevíleas)
address: Av. Cerro Azul, 200 - Zona 02, Maringá - PR, 87010-000
description: A popular urban forest offering walking trails, exercise equipment, and a peaceful environment for recreation and relaxation.

name: Museu da Bacia do Paraná
address: Av. Colombo, 5790 - Bloco G-90 - Zona 07, Maringá - PR, 87020-900
description: Located within UEM, this museum showcases the natural and cultural history of the Paraná Basin, with collections on archaeology, ethnology, and natural sciences.
